item.title: Tree cutting, 22nd October
item.description:
The tree in the photos will need cutting bsck, the branches are hanging down really low so it could hurt someone on their face or eyes. Its at the junction with Newton Road and Ellison Road in Cheltenham, outside number 11A

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11a, Newton Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots growing through pavement causing damage and a hazard risk to the public, 22nd October
item.description:
Tree outside number 50 Tennyson Road st marks. The roots have come through the pavement causing damage and a risk of injury to public. The roots are also coming through on number 50s front garden. This could escalate to further growth causing damage to the structure of the house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Customer states that the wait on these temp lights (90+ secs) is too long, causing frustration among road users and leading to vehicles to jump the lights because it looks like they're stuck on red. Customer also states that temp lights should not be needed due to the extent of works, and that it could be done under stop and go.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Depression in road surface, 22nd October
item.description:
Carriageway outside property called Silver Leys, Winchcombe Road, Brockhampton, GL54 5TH What3Words ///sprouting.sometimes.quarrel The road has recently been surfaced prior to being chipped next year. This dip wasnâ€™t marked but should be done to level the surface before the chippings are applied.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Abbots Road, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
